section.title: Problem
section.para: You need a drop cap, or Initial, which is a a letter at the beginning of a work, a chapter, or a paragraph that is larger than the rest of the text.

section.title: Solution
section.para: Typographically, you have different options to place initials:

listitem.para: on the same baseline as the first line of text,
as floats, embedded between two or more lines,
besides the text on the left margin.

section.para: Additionally you can design your initials as graphics, but we will come to this later.

section.title: Place Initials on the Same Baseline
section.para: This is the easiest method to implement. You normalize the text node of the first paragraph, extract the first character and wrap it between an fo:inline element with font size, family, and weight.
